summary: Flutter app using layered + feature-based architecture: UI -> State (Provider/Riverpod) -> Services (business logic) -> Data (DB). Core modules planned: authentication (incl. biometrics), encrypted notes, NLP date/time extraction, calendar/event generation, unified dashboard, settings; strict rule that UI never accesses DB directly and all data operations go through services.
architectural_notes: Use 4-layer architecture: Presentation (UI), State Management, Business Logic (Services), Data layer.
Presentation layer must not communicate directly with the database; all data operations go through service classes.
Feature-based folder structure under lib/features (auth, dashboard, notes, calendar, ai, settings) plus core/, services/, models/, routes/.
Recommended state management: Riverpod or Provider; avoid heavy setState in large-scale app.
Recommended pattern: UI -> Provider -> Service -> Database.
Encryption module uses AES-256; encryption key stored in secure storage; encrypt notes before saving and decrypt on retrieval.
NLP expected output structure includes date/time/confidence; NLP can be local (PyThaiNLP via backend) or API-based.
Database options considered: SQLite (sqflite) recommended for thesis alignment; cloud options include Supabase/Firebase.

existing_features.title: Create a feature-based, layered frontend code organization that enforces unidirectional flow: UI components must not call the backend actor directly; instead, UI uses feature-scoped hooks/state → service layer → actor client calls.
Implement authentication using Internet Identity and enforce authenticated access for note, event, and settings operations.
Implement notes management (create, edit, delete, list) with support for marking a note as private and storing private notes encrypted end-to-end (ciphertext stored on the backend).

Add a client-side encryption service using AES-256 (Web Crypto) with a per-user key stored locally in the browser; encrypt private notes before sending them to the backend and decrypt them after retrieval.
Implement an NLP/date-time extraction module that analyzes note text locally (no external AI services) and produces structured output { date, time, confidence } to drive event suggestions.
Implement calendar management with a monthly calendar view and daily agenda; allow creating events manually and allow creating an event from a note based on the extracted date/time suggestion.

Create a unified dashboard screen that surfaces key actions and summaries for notes and calendar (e.g., recent notes and today’s agenda) and provides navigation to core features (Notes, Calendar, Settings).
Add a Settings screen/module with basic user options relevant to this web app (e.g., manage encryption key lifecycle actions like reset/export warnings, and general UI preferences if applicable).

Implement a clear step-by-step delivery plan inside the repo (as documentation) describing incremental milestones for building the modules in order, mapping each milestone to the app routes/features and backend endpoints.
Apply a coherent visual theme across the frontend (colors, typography, spacing, component usage) suitable for a secure productivity app, and enforce consistency across all feature screens.

new_feature_requests.summary: Implement layered + feature-based Flutter project structure with unidirectional flow (UI -> Provider -> Service -> Database) and routing
Authentication system: login/registration, secure token/session management, biometric auth (local_auth + flutter_secure_storage)
Notes management: create/edit/delete notes, include encrypted private notes
Encryption & data security: AES-256 client-side encryption with key stored in secure storage; encrypt before save and decrypt on retrieval
NLP module for date/time extraction from note text (local backend via PyThaiNLP or API-based service) producing structured output and event suggestions
Calendar module: monthly view + daily agenda; generate calendar events from NLP extraction; optional device calendar sync (table_calendar/device_calendar)
Unified dashboard interface integrating notes, AI/NLP, and calendar
Step-by-step implementation plan for building the app modules incrementally
